DatabaseAccess
Class ExtDBAccess

java.lang.Object
  DatabaseAccess.ExtDBAccess
All Implemented Interfaces:
ExtDBAccessI
public class ExtDBAccess
extends java.lang.Object
implements ExtDBAccessI

Singleton class that handles all database access for external services. Please note that this class cannot be instantiated manually. The only way to access this class is through the getInstance() method.

Author:
Ralph

Method Detail

getInstance

public static ExtDBAccessI getInstance()
Retrieves the active instance of this class. Enforces only having one global instance for database access accross the entire project.

Returns:
the active instance of the public database access object

Parameters:

t - the time of the review (year, month, day, hour, minute)

restaurantsForNameContains

public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> restaurantsForNameContains(java.lang.String name)
Description copied from interface: ExtDBAccessI
Returns a list of businessIDs of businesses whose names contain the inputed name. If the input parameter is null or has 0 length, the method returns null.

Specified by:
restaurantsForNameContains in interface ExtDBAccessI
Parameters:
name - the part of the business name to check for
Returns:
{businessID: string, businessName: string, address: string}

Specified by:

                                                          double latitude,

Description copied from interface: ExtDBAccessI

Returns:
